circumstances:
Shortly after takeoff from Edwards AFB (Muroc Dry Lake), the twin engine airplane encountered difficulties to gain height. It stalled and crashed past the runway end, bursting into flames. All eight crew members were killed. 
Crew:
Lt John H. Work, pilot, 
Lt Theodore M. Richards, copilot, 
Pfc Frank Serao, bomber, 
Pfc Alfred G. Legenhausen, engineer, 
Pfc Gerald J. Lucien, radio operator, 
Pvt Thomas J. Kennedy, air gunner +2.
probable_cause: An excessive accumulation of ice on frame and all aircraft surfaces, increased drag and reduced lift, causing the airplane to stall shortly after liftoff.
